text: The women's 100 metres hurdles sprint competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was Edith Noeding of Peru. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |12.48 |Fürth, West Germany |June 10, 1978 |- |Pan American Games record | |13.1 |Cali, Colombia |1971 |} ==Results== All times are in seconds. Deby LaPlante's winning time of 12.90 seconds in the final was not registered as a Pan American record because of wind conditions. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font-size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Heats=== Wind: Heat 1: +3.4 m/s, Heat 2: +2.8 m/s {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text- align:center" |- !Rank !!
